perturbation.original_text: This Co-Hosting Agreement (the "Agreement") is made by and between NETWORKS ASSOCIATES, INC., a Delaware corporation, doing business as Network Associates, Inc., with its principal place of business at 3965 Freedom Circle, Santa Clara, California 95054 ("NAI"), and SOFTWARE.NET CORPORATION, a Delaware corporation, a.k.a. Beyond.com, with its principal place of business at 1195 West Fremont Avenue, Sunnyvale, California 94087 ("Co-Host"). The Effective Date of this Agreement (herein called the "Effective Date") is September 21, 1998.
perturbation.changed_text: This Co-Hosting Agreement (the "Arrangement") is made by and between NETWORKS ASSOCIATES, INC., a Delaware corporation, doing business as Network Associates, Inc., with its principal place of business at 3965 Freedom Circle, Santa Clara, California 95054 ("NAI"), and SOFTWARE.NET CORPORATION, a Delaware corporation, a.k.a. Beyond.com, with its principal place of business at 1195 West Fremont Avenue, Sunnyvale, California 94087 ("Co-Host"). The Effective Date of this Agreement (herein called the "Effective Date") is September 21, 1998.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Agreement' to 'Arrangement' in one place introduces ambiguity.  Later sections refer to 'Agreement' creating confusion whether the obligations of the 'Agreement' apply to what is now called the 'Arrangement' here.

perturbation.original_text: Co-Host represents and warrants to NAI that Co-Host has all right, title, ownership interest and/or marketing rights necessary to provide the advertising materials to NAI, to perform its obligations hereunder and to operate the Destination. Each party further represents and warrants to the other that it has not entered into any agreements or commitments which are inconsistent with or in conflict with the rights granted or obligations incurred by the representing party in this Agreement. Co-Host further represents and warrants that the advertising materials supplied hereunder do not infringe any Covered Country (hereinafter defined) copyright, trademark, or trade secret right. Covered Country shall mean the United States of America and any member state of the European Economic Union.
perturbation.changed_text: Co-Host represents and warrants to NAI that Co-Host has all right, title, ownership interest and/or marketing rights necessary to provide the advertising materials to NAI, to perform its obligations hereunder and to operate the Destination. Each party further represents and warrants to the other that it has not entered into any agreements or commitments which are inconsistent with or in conflict with the rights granted or obligations incurred by the representing party in this Arrangement. Co-Host further represents and warrants that the advertising materials supplied hereunder do not infringe any Covered Country (hereinafter defined) copyright, trademark, or trade secret right. Covered Country shall mean the United States of America and any member state of the European Economic Union.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Agreement' to 'Arrangement' only in one place introduces ambiguity.  It's unclear if all following sections refer to the same 'Agreement' from the beginning or only this 'Arrangement', creating uncertainty about which specific agreement is being referenced for obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Co-Host will use commercially reasonable efforts to market the Products it orders to the best of its ability, and to that end will (i) conduct marketing activities authorized by NAI, (ii) support special promotions initiated by NAI, and (iii) maintain a sound financial condition. Co-Host will conduct its business in a manner that reflects favorably upon the Products and NAI.
perturbation.changed_text: Co-Host will use commercially reasonable efforts to market the Goods it orders to the best of its ability, and to that end will (i) conduct marketing activities authorized by NAI, (ii) support special promotions initiated by NAI, and (iii) maintain a sound financial condition. Co-Host will conduct its business in a manner that reflects favorably upon the Goods and NAI.
perturbation.explanation: The contract consistently uses "Products" (defined later in Exhibit E) to refer to items for distribution. Changing it to "Goods" (defined in the Recitals) introduces uncertainty.  Is Co-Host required to market all "Goods" mentioned, or just the subset specifically contracted as "Products" for distribution under Exhibit E. This affects the scope of marketing obligations.
